intro: Acmispon flexuosus, commonly known as the slender burro's tail, is a low-growing annual plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, branching stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces elongated, spiny pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert and semi-arid environments. Acmispon flexuosus is adapted to hot, dry climates and is a common component of native plant communities in its range.
